history.proof: intros. unfold Zp_plus, Z_Zp. sfirstorder depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
Z_Zp -> Z_Zp

Premises:
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
Zp_plus = fun H : Z_Zp => let (x, _) := H in fun H0 : Z_Zp => let (y, _) := H0 in exist (fun x0 : nat => x0 < p) (rem (x + y) p) (div_rem_spec2 (x + y) Hp) : Z_Zp -> Z_Zp -> Z_Zp
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
bezout_rel_prime : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q}}
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
div_ge_1 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall n : nat, p <= n -> 1 <= div n p
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z := Nat2Z.is_nonneg p in let __arith : forall __x1 : Z, (...
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}
arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
division_by_even : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {j : nat | arem n d q j}}
Nat.lcm = fun a b : nat => a * (b / Nat.gcd a b) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.lcm (_ _)%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (n * p) (m * p) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (p * n) (p * m) < -> Nat.divide n m
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (exists p : nat, y = p * x) (exists p : nat, y = p * x') (Morphisms_Prop.ex_iff_morphism (fun p : nat => y = p * x) (fun p : nat => y = p * x') (fun p : nat => Morphisms.per_partial_app_morphism (RelationClasses.Equivalence_PER Nat.eq_equiv) (p * x) (p * x') (Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism Nat.mul_wd (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive p) x x' Hx))) (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (exists p : nat, y' = p * x') (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (exists p : nat, y' = p * x')) (Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff...

```coq
intros Z Zp. unfold Zp_plus, Z_Zp. destruct Z as [x Hx], Zp as [y Hy]. unfold Zp_plus, is_lcm in *. split.
- unfold divides. exists (div (x + y) p). rewrite rem_prop with (n:=x+y); auto; apply div_rem_spec2, Hp.
- split.
  + unfold divides. exists p. reflexivity.
  + intros k Hk1 Hk2. unfold divides in Hk1, Hk2. destruct Hk1 as [kp Hkp], Hk2 as [kq Hkq]. rewrite Hkp, Hkq. apply is_gcd_mult_lcm; auto.
Qed.Qed.```

original: intros Z Zp. unfold Zp_plus, Z_Zp. destruct Z as [x Hx], Zp as [y Hy]. unfold Zp_plus, is_lcm in *. split. - unfold divides. exists (div (x + y) p). rewrite rem_prop with (n:=x+y); auto; apply div_rem_spec2, Hp. - split. + unfold divides. exists p. reflexivity. + intros k Hk1 Hk2. unfold divides in Hk1, Hk2. destruct Hk1 as [kp Hkp], Hk2 as [kq Hkq]. rewrite Hkp, Hkq. apply is_gcd_mult_lcm; auto.
